perturbation.original_text: Territory shall mean Exclusivity for the state of Texas, USA, and Exclusive Distribution opportunities in all other states (with either the Company or Distributor), except the state of Florida.
perturbation.changed_text: Territory shall mean Exclusivity for the state of Texas, USA. The Company reserves the right to appoint other distributors in any other state, including states where the Distributor already has established a presence, except the state of Florida.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants exclusivity for Texas and exclusive opportunities elsewhere. The modified text allows the Company to appoint other distributors anywhere outside Texas and Florida, even where the Distributor has established a presence, contradicting the exclusive distribution opportunities.

perturbation.original_text: 12.1 Generally. This contract shall remain in effect initially for the five (5) year term ("Initial Term") from the date signed and shall be automatically extended for one (1) year periods after the Initial Term ("Renewal Term") unless (i) either party provides written notice of its intention not to renew the Agreement within 180 days prior to any Renewal Term; or (ii) this Agreement is otherwise terminated pursuant to the terms of this Section 12.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.1 Generally. This contract shall remain in effect initially for the five (5) year term ("Initial Term") from the date signed and shall not be automatically extended. Any extension of the agreement after the initial term is subject to mutual written agreement by both parties no less than 30 days prior to the end of the Initial Term, otherwise the agreement will terminate automatically.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stipulates automatic renewal unless a party provides notice of non-renewal. The modified text eliminates automatic renewal, instead requiring mutual agreement for any extension. This directly contradicts the original provision regarding automatic renewal.

perturbation.original_text: 10. ARBITRATION: Any dispute arising over the terms and conditions of this Agreement or in any manner relating to this Agreement which the parties are unable to resolve informally between themselves or by mediation shall be submitted, upon the motion of either party, to arbitration under the appropriate rules of the American Arbitration Association ("AAA"). All such arbitration proceedings shall be administered by the AAA and held in Dallas, Texas. The parties agree that the decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding as to each of them.
perturbation.changed_text: 10. ARBITRATION: Any dispute arising over the terms and conditions of this Agreement or in any manner relating to this Agreement which the parties are unable to resolve informally between themselves or by mediation may be submitted, upon the motion of either party, to arbitration under the appropriate rules of the American Arbitration Association ("AAA"). All such arbitration proceedings shall be administered by the AAA and held in Dallas, Texas. The parties agree that the decision of the arbitrator shall be advisory and non-binding.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that the arbitrator's decision is final and binding. The modified text states that the arbitrator's decision is advisory and non-binding. This directly contradicts the final and binding nature of arbitration.
